data.why:
Planning to contribute Unicode related modules for languages spoken
    in India. These modules allow one to compose Unicode text strings in
    the targetted languages using the standard QWERT keyboard employing
    a phonotic transliterarion aproach. Transliteration is quite
    appropriate and popular method for encoding Indian languages. The
    modules being contributed provide for reversing the unicode strings
    back to printable qwerty keyboard characters to the maximum extent
    possible (most times 100%) Using these modules it will become easy
    to compose and publish web pages in Indian languages. For examnple
    HTML::Mason can employed to transliterate relevent portions of the
    web page into Indian language fonts. I believe these modules can
    make a good impact on Indian web publishing community because they
    provide a way to quickly deliver content in multiple Indian
    languages with the same phonotic source code text. Of course
    different portions of a web page can display different fonts Indian
    or otherwise without any problem.
